section.title: Main Interface
section.para:
The main interface is composed of the following components:
Character Info Pane Target Info Pane Control Pane Experience Pane Tabs Pane Status Bar
The character info pane displays your character's name, class, level, health, mana, and heading. Additioinally, an icon representing the class is displayed.
The target info pane displays your target's name, level, and health as well as the number of kills, loots, and deaths that Glider has accumulated since it last started running a profile.
The control pane provides buttons that allow you to connect to/ disconnect from Glider, start and stop Glider, and to restore, shrink, and hide the WoW window.
The experience pane displays your estimated time to level, your current experience, the total experience needed to level, the experience percentage, and experience per hour.
The tabs pane contains the various tabs that are described in the next section.
The status bar informs you when you are connected or disconnected from Glider, if Glider is attached, what profile Glider is currently running, and the status when the screenshot is being updated.
